title.narrative: F.a: Capacity Building Programme for Social Responsibility

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to motivate, train and empower the church partners to respond to their target countries’ social problems in coordination with other organisations working in the region. The partners have a significant role in reaching people of the regions, if their work is directed outside of the traditional church building. Fida partners with Fundacion y Educacion en Servicio + Asambleas de Dios Renovada in Bolivia, Asociacion de Iglesias Evangelicas in Paraguay, and Asambleas de Dios in Peru. The project beneficiaries are the partners, the partners’ work centres’ neighbourhoods and the region’s children and youth. South America’s social problems in the current target countries are very similar. This is why the partners can work in close coordination with each other, making a mutually beneficial learning process possible. The project work is based on the preventive treatment of the most general social problems. The large number of volunteers affiliated with the partners contributes to the achievement of the project’s aims. The partner is able to work in its target country as a significant non-governmental organisation. Its work is not limited to just traditional work done inside the church. The reach has been extended by stepping out int o the neighbourhoods in order to help the neighbours. For the suburb’s people, the project’s goal is the positive and protective effect of preventive teaching in, for example domestic violence, mistreatment and substance abuse. The partner is motivated and trained to be a significant influence in its community. At the same time, the partner’s work is expanded out of the traditional church buildings and into the region’s communities. Cooperation with other actors in the region enables networking, whi ch enables purpose in the realisation of wider cooperation. The partner is committed to motivating and training its community so, that social responsibility is not limited to outside aid only. The planning, implementation and monitoring of the partner’s own work tells of the partner’s adaptation of the work as part of its own holistic action
